item.title: About
item.description:
A site of my random ramblings. I’m a semi-retired 45-year veteran of the engineering software trenches, with stints at the Jet Propulsion Lab, a small appraisal research firm, and 35 years with MSC Software, one of the leading providers of computer-aided engineering tools.

I bought a new 2005 Yamaha FJR1300A in August, 2004, and used the handle tcfjr on the FJR1300 forum. (I lived in a town called Temple City at the time.) I still have that bike - now with 140,000 miles, and still running strong.

Find me on Bluesky

item.title: Delight
item.description: “The true delight is in the finding out, rather than in the knowing.” — Isaac Asimov

item.title: Just Deserts
item.description: Many people believe the idiom for someone getting what they deserve is “just desserts”, but in fact it’s “just deserts”. It’s a now defunct version of the word “deserts” meaning “that which one deserves” that only survives today in that one idiom. But is is pronounced just like “desserts”.

item.title: Harbor
item.description: “A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for.”  - John A. Shedd

item.title: Add Life
item.description: “I don’t ride a bike to add days to my life. I ride a bike to add life to my days.”  - Anonymous

item.title: Game 5
item.description:
As a long-time Dodger fan - I went to my first game at Dodger Stadium back in 1965 - I was really happy to see them win game 5 today at Yankee Stadium to close-out this year’s World Series.

We can all agree that that fifth inning defensive display by the Yankees was horrible, but their overall defense throughout the series was really weak. It’s hard to understand, but their coaching staff has to take the brunt of the blame.

item.title: Red Flags
item.description:
“When you wear rose-colored glasses, all the red flags just look like flags”
 - Anonymous

item.title: Peanut Butter and Pickle
item.description:
Since I was a kid, I’ve always enjoyed peanut butter and pickle sandwiches. It’s a little weird, I guess. You take two slices of bread, slab on some creamy peanut butter on both sides, lay some pickles on and close up the sandwich. Then enjoy.

You can use either dill pickles or sweet pickles. Each has their own flavor, but either one makes for a fantastic sandwich.

Elvis famously enjoyed peanut butter and banana sandwiches. Maybe once I become famous the world will start to enjoy peanut butter and pickle.

item.title: The Tree Remembers
item.description:
“The ax forgets, but the tree remembers”
 - African proverb
